Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The idstore server is configured using a single JSON-formatted configuration file.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The Mail section of the configuration file configures the mail service. The server sends mail to users to verify emails and to handle password resets.

Subsection.title: Transport
Subsection.Paragraph: The Transport section of the Mail configuration specifies the mail server transport method. This must be one of SMTP, SMTP_TLS, or SMTPS.
The Host and Port properties specify the host and port of the upstream MTA.

Subsection.title: Sender
Subsection.Paragraph: The Sender property specifies the address that will be used on outgoing mail.

Subsection.title: VerificationExpiration
Subsection.Paragraph: The VerificationExpiration property specifies how long links sent in emails will take to expire. These links are currently used for password resets, and email verification. The property must be formatted as an ISO 8601 duration string.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The HTTP section of the configuration file configures the various HTTP services.

Subsection.title: AdminAPIService
Subsection.Paragraph: The configuration for the Admin API service.
The SessionDirectory property specifies a directory that will contain persistent state for user sessions. This allows user logins to persist across server restarts.

The ListenAddress and ListenPort properties specify the address and port to which to the HTTP service will bind. It is recommended that the service be bound to localhost and a reverse proxy such as nginx be used to provide TLS.

The ExternalAddress property specifies the external address that clients will use to connect to this server. This value is used in, for example, password reset emails to provide URLs that users can follow to reset their passwords.
The SessionExpiration property, if present, specifies the duration after which idle sessions on the server will expire. The value must be expressed as an ISO 8601 duration string.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The RateLimiting section of the configuration file configures rate limiting for various server operations. Primarily, rate limiting is currently useful to limit any outgoing email that the server might send; unauthenticated clients could, for example, attempt to spam users with password reset emails. Setting a rate limit such that only one password reset email can be sent every ten minutes for a given client can reduce the possible damage.

The EmailVerificationRateLimit property specifies the minimum duration that must elapse between any two email verification requests for a given user. The property must be specified as an ISO 8601 duration string.

The PasswordResetRateLimit property specifies the minimum duration that must elapse between any two password reset requests from a single IP address. The property must be specified as an ISO 8601 duration string.
